symptoms.name: Urethritis
symptoms.pattern: Transient, frothy, or purulent discharge; dysuria; frequency (usually early morning); minimal urethral irritation; occasional moisture at the urethral meatus

symptoms.name: Vaginitis (in women)
symptoms.pattern: Copious, yellow-green, frothy vaginal discharge with a fishy odor; soreness of the vulva and perineum; dyspareunia; dysuria; inflammation and edema of the vulva and perineum; punctate, red “strawberry” spots on vaginal walls and cervix

symptoms.name: Asymptomatic
symptoms.pattern: May be asymptomatic in both men and women

physical_findings: Punctate, red “strawberry” spots on vaginal walls and cervix (in women)
Inflammation and edema of the vulva and perineum (in women)
risk_factors: Coinfection with gonorrhea and other STIs

required: Positive lab test for Trichomonas vaginalis (NAATs, microscopy, culture, dipstick tests)
